file_content.text: I never expected to see you again.
Does this mean you ventured beyond the Forbidden Pass and found Master Yonlach?
The mission is complete.
That's right.
Child's play for me.
If you hadn't been such a coward, you wouldn't have to ask.
You'll never know.
I deserve that.
This is a great lesson. The only barriers that exist are the ones we create in our minds.
I will never again assume that I know all there is to know. And I will explore the entirety of the Tatooine desert without reservation.
You have learned much from this.
Glad I could inspire you.
Good luck to you.
I will strike a balance between care and daring.
I don't care what you do.
Knock yourself out.
It is my great shame that I have not endeared myself to you.
I hope Lord Baras knows how fortunate he is to have such a fine champion shepherding his cause. I shall never forget you.
I'll remember you fondly as well.
I'm glad we met.
Goodbye.
I'm going to forget I ever met you.
Good riddance.
Even the dunes change their shape over time. Perhaps one day you'll think of me differently.
Safe travels, my lord. If you're ever on Tatooine again, come and see me.
Ugh. I hope we never come back to this sandy inferno. It's bad for my complexion.
If we never return here, I won't miss it.
I agree.
I'm glad we're on the same page.
You look good with a tan, Vette.
[Flirt] It's done you no harm.
You know just what to say, don't you?
Try not to be so self-absorbed.
How very vain of you.
Try not to be so self-absorbed.
How very vain of you.
Hey, I'll have you know, Twi'leks have very sensitive skin.
When I want you to make noise, I'll shock you.
Keep quiet. [Shock Vette]
Ow ow ow! Man, that smarts!
Shut up, Twi'lek.
Quiet.
Shutting up now.
It will be a pleasure to put this overheated sandbox behind us.
Yes. I've had my fill of sunshine.
I agree.
You look good with a tan, Captain.
[Flirt] Sunshine becomes you.
I hope it hides my blushes, my lord.
You're not typically one to complain, Quinn.
It must really bother you.
I won't make a habit of it, my lord.
You will endure wherever we go quietly.
Quit whining.
A momentary lapse, my lord.
I will ready the ship for our departure.
This parchment the Sand Person brought is remarkable. It is a crude but very clear map of the desert.
It marks a door carved into the wall of the Desert Wound Ravine. But I've mapped this ravine, and there is no such door.
If this is where the Padawan went, I must follow.
I'll search for it.
I shudder to think what awaits you there.
Perhaps the Sand People know the desert better than you.
You must be wrong.
Perhaps. An unsettling thought.
What more do you know?
I can tell you that humans are very low on the food chain there.
The ravine marks the farthest I or anyone I know of has dared venture.
Here are the coordinates. I will follow stealthed, using the dune's shadows.
Just stay out of my way.
Leave the real work to me.
I am not much use in hand-to-hand combat anyway.
Think first of your own safety, and do not follow if it becomes too harrowing.
Be careful.
Your concern is appreciated.
Darth Baras enlisted my services to be scout and lookout, and I intend to do my job.
Then I'll see you there.
Fine.
You won't see me until I wish to be seen.
Head deeper into the desert and you will find the Desert Wound Ravine. Safe journey.
I trailed and observed your descent here. I could not believe my eyes.
The Sand People all ran from you. What transpired inside the sand demon cave that makes this so?
It was an epic battle, and I killed the beast.
The demon is no more.
You have bathed in the demon's blood. Its essence fills the air.
I mastered the demon without lifting a finger, and it shed its skin.
I tamed the beast.
Remarkable. And you have bathed in the demon's essence. The Jedi Padawan must have done the same.
I have no idea why the Sand People ran.
I'm at a loss.
It's not your concern.
Now that I see you close-up, I can guess. You have the demon's blood all over you. It's essence follows you.
Now, Izzeebowe said that this is where your path will be illuminated. But there doesn't seem to be anything here... wait!
On your guard, offworlder. One of the Sand People approaches.
[The Sand People Shaman cowers and grunts. He bows before you and holds out a weathered parchment.]
I'll take that.
[Take the parchment]
[The Sand Person bows once more and then flees.]
I will respond in kind.
[Bow]
[The Sand Person hands the parchment to Sharack and quickly leaves.]
I've never seen one of the Sand People approach an outsider in peace.
Enough of this!
[Kill the Sand Person]
[The Sand People Shaman does nothing to stop you.]
It didn't even attempt to defend itself. I've never seen one of its kind be so passive.
I'll humor Izzeebowe while you confront the sand demon. Then I will pick up your trail and meet you at the Sand People compound.
The harsh sands of Tatooine welcome you. I am Sharack Breev.
Our lord and master Darth Baras bid me to impart my knowledge of this planet and help you track down the Jedi Master Yonlach.
Just tell me where to find the Jedi.
That's right.
It is not such a simple matter.
Good to meet you.
I'm glad to have your assistance.
Good to meet you.
I will be your compass.
Baras is only my master in name.
I'm no one's underling.
I did not mean to offend, my lord. You and you alone will be my master during this time.
See to it you remember that.
That's better.
I will waste no more of your time then.
The offense was slight. I am not easily bruised.
Relax.
Your fortitude will serve you well on your journey here.
Complete subservience is the only way you will survive the experience.
Pray I don't kill you.
Then I will launch myself into the task at hand immediately.
You will find Master Yonlach by tracing the path the Padawan and her Master took. I can tell you where they started.
I followed them to the forbidden lair of the ancient sand demon, a terrible beast. The Padawan left her weapons and entered alone. Impossibly, she returned unscathed.
She brought the Force. It is a powerful weapon.
A Jedi is never unarmed.
I have witnessed the power of the Force, but this goes beyond wonder.
Interesting.
Maybe the demon was not in its lair.
So the beast was away.
I thought that as well.
The sand demon is the fiercest creature on this planet. You don't just walk into its lair and return without a scratch.
I investigated further. The beast was there, also undamaged--and what's most perplexing, its skin was glistening.
Somehow, she avoided fighting the demon.
So, there was no skirmish.
That appears to be the only conclusion.
That is very confusing. Was it bleeding?
Glistening?
Not blood as from a wound. More like the layer of living gel one is born into the world covered in.
Maybe you need your eyes checked.
You must be mistaken.
This was no mistake. The beast was whole and covered in a viscous layer as if newly born.
What happened in that cave is a mystery, as is where the Padawan and her Master went afterwards.
There is one man on Tatooine who might be able to explain. Izzeebowe Jeef. He's as old as the sand. Part mad man, part soothsayer.
I want to talk with this man immediately.
Get me an audience.
Tell me more about this man.
What's his story?
They say the planet talks to him. He predicts sandstorms and directs search parties to lost children.
Better not be a waste of time.
Sounds like a crack pot.
If anyone can deduce why the Padawan sought the sand demon, it is he.
It will not be easy to speak with Jeef. The small farming settlement where he lives has been overrun by Exchange thugs.
The Exchange hates the Empire for running them out of Mos Ila. They will allow me to pass, but they'll attack you on sight.
They won't see me coming until it's too late.
Not if I strike first.
So what?
Then I will meet you at Izzeebowe Jeef's hut.
Thanks for looking out for me.
Appreciate the warning.
I'm invested in seeing you succeed. And I will meet you at Izzeebowe Jeef's.
